section.heading: D.C. General Hospital Hospice Program; established.

para.text: There is established a hospice program to be administered by the D.C. General Hospital. The purpose of this program shall be to:
Provide care and support for the patients who have a terminal condition;
Educate consumers and providers regarding the benefits of hospice programs; and
Encourage volunteerism to assist the terminally ill.
The program shall be designed to enable the patient to live as fully as possible during the final period of his or her life.

The program shall be administered by the Hospice Program Coordinator (“Coordinator”), who shall be appointed by the Executive Director of D.C. General Hospital (“Executive Director”), with the consent of the D.C. General Hospital Commission (“Hospital Commission”), within 120 days after March 16, 1989. The Coordinator position shall be full-time.
The duties of the Coordinator shall include, but not be limited to:
Assisting and counseling the family of the patient before and after the death of the patient;
Educating the D.C. General Hospital health-care staff and the community about the hospice concept and the program’s activities;
Establishing a hospice volunteer program utilizing existing systems and community resources;
Selecting, with the consent of the Executive Director and the Hospital Commission, a location to carry out the functions of the program; and
Establishing an inpatient component of the program pursuant to § 44-1801 et seq. [repealed].
There shall be a hospice care team that shall carry out the purposes of this chapter and provide for the physical, emotional, and spiritual needs of the terminally ill patient.
